sentences.english: The bailout will, in fact, solve several of G.M.’s biggest problems.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，這次的救助確實會解決通用的一些頑疾。

sentences.english: Malaria is an ancient and persistent disease.
sentences.chinese: 瘧疾是一個古老的頑疾。

sentences.english: Remember the monk "mud bodhisattva" and his terrible skin infections?
sentences.chinese: 還記得“泥菩薩”和他可怕的頑疾麼？

sentences.english: Sugar for many is something they may have been battling with for a long time, but the past is the past.
sentences.chinese: 對許多人來說，糖也許早就是久攻不下的頑疾了。

sentences.english: Waste  disposal is one of the biggest headaches for cities.
sentences.chinese: 垃圾處理是許多城市的頑疾之一。

sentences.english: An imbalance between the rich and poor is the oldest and most fatal ailment of republic.
sentences.chinese: 貧富不均，這是共和國最古老和致命的頑疾。

sentences.english: Manchester has social blights of its own.
sentences.chinese: 曼徹斯特也有自己的頑疾。

sentences.english: Failing to pay the tuition fee malevolently has become a serious problem which blocks the development of universities.
sentences.chinese: 惡意拖欠學費問題已經成爲困擾高校發展的一個頑疾。

sentences.english: The country's intractable political problems are contributing to the problem.
sentences.chinese: 泰國的政治頑疾是出現這一問題的原因之一。

sentences.english: Electric bikes were once touted as a solution to China’s transportation woes.
sentences.chinese: 電動車曾一度被稱爲是解決中國交通頑疾的一劑良藥。

definition: (Tw) to guide sb in the right direction/to correct (behavior etc)

pinyin: zi4 ti3 mian3 yi4 ji2 bing4

definition: to treat the symptoms/reactive (rather than proactive)
inner product/the dot product of two vectors
variant Chinese character/alternative form of a Chinese character
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
